contents: Volcanoes form when magma, molten and semi-molten rock beneath the Earth’s surface, rises and (9) <u>leeks</u> (9) <u>through</u> a (9) <u>rupture</u> in the Earth's crust. When a volcano erupts, it spews hot molten rock, ash, and gases. When this mixture reaches the Earth’s surface, (10) <u>he is</u> called lava. When lava cools, it forms volcanic rock, including basalt and rhyolite. Complex factors such as the gases and minerals in the magma and the amount of built-up pressure affect how the volcano behaves.
